items.sentence: I still sometimes think about how things could\'ve been.
It\'s probably going to be hard for you to leave Boston.
The man waiting in the lobby wouldn\'t give me his name.
I wonder if you could talk Tom into helping us tomorrow.
I wonder whether Tom knew Mary needed to do that or not.
I wonder whether or not Tom should really be doing that.
I wonder whether or not Tom still remembers how to swim.
There\'s a fishing lodge near Boston that I often go to.
There\'s a good chance that Tom will be the new manager.
There\'s no evidence that Tom has done anything illegal.
How much time does it usually take you to eat breakfast?
I bought a magazine at a store just outside the station.
I should\'ve phoned Tom before I went over to visit him.
Since no one knew me there, I told them my name was Tom.
Some of the people in the waiting room were watching TV.
Tom hugged Mary and gave her a little kiss on the cheek.
We\'re trying to find ourselves something decent to eat.
We moved to Boston so the kids would have a better life.
We never stay in Boston for more than a couple of weeks.
Why do you think that I\'m the only one who can do that?
